en.title: Why Cats Hide: What to Do When Your Cat Hides in a New Environment
en.content:
Hiding is a natural defensive instinct for cats. It is especially common right after bringing a cat home or when their environment changes.

Common Reasons for Hiding

The main reasons include wariness of a new environment, fear or stress, feeling unwell, a noisy environment, and the presence of visitors.

What to Do Right After Bringing Your Cat Home

First of all, don't worry too much -- hiding is perfectly normal behavior. Don't try to pull your cat out. Instead, provide a safe hiding spot and place food, water, and a litter box nearby. Keep quiet and let your cat come out at their own pace. In most cases, they will start to feel comfortable within a few hours to a few days.

When to Be Concerned

If your cat hasn't eaten or drunk anything for more than 2 days, or appears lethargic, they may be feeling unwell. Please consult your veterinarian.

zh.title: 猫咪躲藏的原因：到新环境后躲起来时的应对方法
zh.content:
猫咪躲藏是一种自然的防御本能。特别是在刚接回家或环境发生变化时尤为常见。

躲藏的主要原因

对新环境的警戒、恐惧或压力、身体不适、嘈杂的环境、有客人来访等是主要原因。

刚接回家时的应对

首先，不必过于担心，躲藏本身是正常行为。不要硬把猫咪拉出来，确保有安全的藏身处，在附近放好猫粮、水和猫砂盆。保持安静，等待猫咪按自己的节奏出来。大多数情况下，几小时到几天就会逐渐适应。

需要注意的情况

如果超过2天完全不吃不喝，或者精神萎靡，可能是身体不适。请咨询兽医。
